message.content:
cs.RO, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.AI, cs.CV 

The paper proposes a method for generating open loop controllers for an agent solving point-to-point reaching tasks, which falls under the category of robotics (cs.RO). The method involves defining the controller output as a linear combination of predefined actuations, which can be interpreted as a machine learning approach (cs.LG). The paper also mentions the developmental perspective of the method, which involves the agent autonomously synthesizing and adapting an effective set of synergies to new behavioral needs, which can be seen as a form of neural networks (cs.NE). The evaluation of the framework involves a planar kinematic chain, which can be considered as a computer vision problem (cs.CV). Finally, the paper uses optimization techniques to quantify the quality of the solutions, which can be categorized under artificial intelligence (cs.AI).
